column4: hey i need some help.  my internet is messed up.  I can visit websites by IP, but not by name.  My /etc/resolv.conf file is empty, and resolvconf won't update it
you can download a .bin from the real website
it works just fine
i use it :-P
anyone know how to fix /etc/resolv.conf?
do you connect to the net via a router?
I'm behind a server and I have a static IP
assumin you know that much, do you know what the DNS server is supposed to be? the IP?
yes, and i have it set.  I can visit sites by IP :-P
you have set it, and it blanks itself out?
no, i have internet
you run something like sudo gedit /etc/resolv.conf    and put nameserver 12.45.45.34 (the IP of DNS server) ?
I haven't done that; /etc/resolv.conf says it shouldn't be edited by hand
i know, normally dhclient3 fills it. however you can use the GUI instead
what gui?
in the top right hand cornor you have the network screen icon yes?
dhclient3 fixed it.  thanks :-)
cool. :)
when i booted up, it was broken again, but i ran dhclient3 again and it works now.  Is it bad to put that in Sessions?
this is to do with the static ip . dhcp uses dhclient3 to get ipaddress information from the network instead of applying it manually
you can try the menu > System > Administration > Network"
no, that's setup fine
there is a tab to enter the DNS, you can set it manuall there yourself.
